text: Karel Kolář (16 December 1955 – 4 October 2017) was a 400 metres runner from the Czech Republic, who represented Czechoslovakia. He won two medals at the European Indoor Championships and two at the 1978 European Championships. ==Achievements== {| |- |rowspan=2|1978 |European Championships |Prague, Czechoslovakia |bgcolor="silver"| 2nd |400 m |- |European Championships |Prague, Czechoslovakia |bgcolor="cc9966"| 3rd |4 × 400 m relay |- |1979 |European Indoor Championships |Vienna, Austria |bgcolor="gold"| 1st |400 m |- |1980 |European Indoor Championships |Sindelfingen, West Germany |bgcolor="silver"| 2nd |400 m |} ==References== * Category:1955 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1980 Summer Olympics Category:Czech male sprinters Category:Czechoslovak male sprinters Category:Olympic athletes of Czechoslovakia Category:European Athletics Championships medalists Category:People from Jindřichův Hradec
title: Karel Kolář
